title: Contributing to Our Project
text:
I welcome contributions to this project! Whether you’re fixing bugs, improving documentation, or adding new recipes, your input is greatly appreciated. Please follow the guidelines below to contribute to the project effectively.




To add a new recipe to the repository, please follow these steps:

Navigate to the Recipes Folder: Locate the /recipes subfolder in the project directory.
Create a New Recipe File: Create a new .qmd file within the /recipes subfolder for your recipe. To simplify this process, you can copy an existing recipe file as a template or use the template.qmd file as a starting point.
Add Your Recipe: Populate the new .qmd file with your recipe details. Make sure to follow the formatting and structure of the existing recipes for consistency.
Commit Your Changes: Once you’ve added your recipe, commit your changes with a meaningful commit message. For example:
git commit -m "Add new recipe for [Recipe Name]"





By contributing to this project, you agree that your contributions will be licensed under its MIT License. Thank you for your contributions! Together, we can make this project even better.

title: Cheesecake with Meringue Topping
text:
200 g flour
2 tsp baking powder
2 pinches of iodized salt
100 g + 100 g butter
75 g + 150 g + 75 g sugar
4 eggs
500 g quark (e.g. 20% fat content)
250 g sour cream
250 ml Rama Cremefine for cooking, 15% fat
1 packet of vanilla pudding powder for cooking (about 37 g)
1 packet of vanilla sugar

title: Cheesecake with Meringue Topping
text:
200 g flour
2 tsp baking powder
2 pinches of iodized salt
100 g + 100 g butter
75 g + 150 g + 75 g sugar
4 eggs
500 g quark (e.g. 20% fat content)
250 g sour cream
250 ml Rama Cremefine for cooking, 15% fat
1 packet of vanilla pudding powder for cooking (about 37 g)
1 packet of vanilla sugar

title: Cheesecake with Meringue Topping
text:
Procedure

Mix 200 g flour, 2 tsp baking powder, and 1 pinch of salt. Knead with 100 g butter, 75 g sugar, and 1 egg using the dough hooks of an electric hand mixer, then by hand until smooth. Line the form with baking paper or grease it, including the edges. Press the dough into the form, creating an edge. Chill the dough in the form until further use.
Preheat the oven to 180°C (fan: 160°C). Melt 100 g butter in a pot over low heat. Separate 3 eggs; the egg whites will be used later. Beat the egg yolks with the melted butter, 500 g quark, 250 g sour cream, 250 ml Rama Cremefine, 150 g sugar, pudding powder, and vanilla sugar with the beaters of the electric hand mixer until creamy.
Pour the sour cream mixture onto the dough. Bake the cheesecake in the preheated oven for about 60 minutes. If the surface browns too much, cover the cheesecake with aluminum foil.
Beat the egg whites with 1 pinch of salt using the (thoroughly cleaned) beaters of the electric hand mixer until stiff, gradually adding 75 g sugar. Spread the meringue on the cheesecake and bake for another 10-15 minutes in the oven. Let the cheesecake with meringue cool and enjoy.
If the cake with meringue stands for a while, small golden sugar droplets form on the meringue - a completely natural reaction and a pretty effect. The cheesecake with meringue is therefore also called Tear Cake. For best results, cut the cheesecake with meringue using a knife dipped in hot water.

1 teaspoon baking powder
3 medium-sized ripe bananas, peeled
Zest and juice of 1 lemon

2 eggs, preferably organic or free-range, beaten





1 tablespoon tahini

title: Bananabread
text:
125 grams all-purpose flour (unbleached)
125 grams whole wheat or spelt flour
125 grams brown sugar
150 grams small seeds (whatever you like/have: sunflower seeds, pumpkin seeds, walnut kernels, pine nuts, chia seeds, etc.)
1 good pinch of sea salt
1 teaspoon baking powder
3 medium-sized ripe bananas, peeled
Zest and juice of 1 lemon
2 tablespoons olive oil
2 tablespoons natural or unsweetened soy yogurt or coconut yogurt
2 eggs, preferably organic or free-range, beaten





1 tablespoon tahini
3 tablespoons golden powdered sugar or liquid honey
Juice of 1 lemon

title: Bananabread
text:
Procedure

Preheat the oven to 200°C (400°F).
Grease a non-stick loaf pan with butter and dust it with flour (if the loaf pan is not non-stick, you can also line it with parchment paper).
Combine all the dry ingredients in a mixing bowl - flours, sugar, seeds, salt, and baking powder - and mix well.
In another bowl, mash the bananas with a fork (leaving them slightly chunky if desired), then add lemon juice and zest, olive oil, yogurt, and beaten eggs, mixing well.
Add the wet ingredients to the bowl of dry ingredients and gently mix - just enough to combine everything.
Transfer the mixture into the loaf pan and bake for 40 to 45 minutes, or until a toothpick comes out clean.
Optional: While the cake is baking, prepare the Lemon Drizzle. Stir tahini and powdered sugar in a bowl until smooth, add lemon juice, and mix well.
Remove the cake from the oven and let it cool in the pan until it’s cool enough to transfer to a wire rack. While the cake is still warm, place a large plate under the rack, then poke the cake all over with a skewer, pour the drizzle over it, and let it soak in.

title: Vegan Pizza
text:
2 1/4 tsp (1 packet) active dry yeast
1 1/2 cups warm water (110°F or 45°C)
3 1/2 cups all-purpose flour
2 tbsp olive oil
1 tsp sugar
1 tsp salt
1 cup canned crushed tomatoes
2 cloves garlic, minced
1 tbsp olive oil
1 tsp dried oregano
1 tsp dried basil
1/2 cup sliced bell peppers
1/2 cup sliced mushrooms
1/4 cup sliced black olives
1/4 cup red onion, thinly sliced
Fresh basil leaves for garnish

title: Vegan Pizza
text:
Procedure

1. Prepare the Dough:
In a small bowl, combine the warm water, sugar, and yeast. Let it sit for about 5-10 minutes until it becomes frothy. In a large bowl, mix the flour and salt. Make a well in the center and add the yeast mixture and olive oil. Stir until the dough comes together, then knead on a floured surface for about 8-10 minutes until the dough is smooth and elastic. Place the dough in a lightly oiled bowl, cover with a damp cloth, and let it rise in a warm place for about 1-1.5 hours, or until it has doubled in size.


2. Prepare the Tomato Sauce:
In a saucepan, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and sauté for about 1 minute until fragrant. Add the crushed tomatoes, oregano, basil, salt, and pepper. Simmer for about 15-20 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the sauce thickens.


3. Assemble the Pizza:
Preheat your oven to 475°F (245°C). Punch down the dough and divide it into two equal portions. Roll out each portion on a floured surface to your desired thickness. Place the rolled-out dough on a pizza stone or baking sheet. Spread a layer of tomato sauce over the dough, leaving a small border for the crust. Sprinkle the vegan mozzarella cheese evenly over the sauce. Arrange the sliced bell peppers, mushrooms, olives, and red onions on top of the cheese.


4. Bake the Pizza:
Bake in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until the crust is golden and the cheese is melted. Remove from the oven and garnish with fresh basil leaves and a drizzle of extra virgin olive oil.

title: Potato salad
text:
1 kilogram Potatoes
1 Onion
5 Eggs
1 Jar of pickles
1 Can of peas and carrots
1 glass Miracel Whip light
Salt and pepper

title: Potato salad
text:
Procedure

Boil the potatoes and eggs and then peel them. When both are cold, cut them into small squares.
Take the pickles out of the jar and keep the water, because you need it later. Then cut the pickles and the onion as well in little pieces.
Drain the carrots and peas. Cut the carrots in slices.
Put the potatoes, pickles, carrots, the onion and the peas into a big bowl.
For the sauce mix Miracel Whip with some water from the jar of pickles, salt and pepper. Add a part of this to the bowl.
Mix the ingredients in the bowl carefully. If it is to dry, add more of the sauce.
Add more salt and pepper according to your taste.
To ensure that it tastes really good, you should prepare the salad a few hours before eating it. You can also prepare it one day before.

some butter and wheat flour for the cake pan

title: Banana Brownies
text:
3 bananas
300 g Dark chocolate coating
250 g butter
3 eggs (size M)
250 g sugar
50 ml of neutral oil (e.g. sunflower oil)
2 TSP vanilla extract
200 g wheat flour (type 405)
30 g Baking cocoa
1 TSP baking powder
some butter and wheat flour for the cake pan

title: Banana Brownies
text:
Procedure

Preheat the oven to 180 degrees top/bottom heat (fan oven: 160 degrees). Grease a baking tin (20 cm x 23 cm) with a little butter and dust with flour. For the batter, peel the bananas and mash with a fork to a fine paste.
Finely chop the dark chocolate coating and melt it together with the butter in a metal bowl over a hot water bath. Beat the eggs and sugar until frothy, then mix in the melted chocolate mixture and the oil. Stir in the mashed bananas and vanilla extract.
Mix the flour, cocoa powder and baking powder in a bowl and sieve into the batter. Mix in briefly, then pour into the prepared tin and smooth out.
Bake the brownies in a preheated oven for approx. 30-35 minutes. Leave to cool for at least 2 hours after baking.

title: The best Florentiners
text:
Procedure

Mix the dough ingredients together and knead until it is a firm dough and leave the dough to rest for 1 hour.
Roll out the dough very thinly and cut out round shapes. Bake for approx. 5 minutes at 180°C fan oven.
Melt the chocolate and coat the base of the cooled cookies with chocolate and leave to harden overnight (or for 2 hours in the fridge).
Heat the whipping cream, sugar, honey and butter in a saucepan, stirring constantly until the mixture caramelizes
dd the flaked almonds, mix well and cook for 3 minutes, stirring until the mixture begins to brown. Transfer to a bowl, stir in 2 tbsp almond kernels. Shape the mixture into mounds using 2 oiled teaspoons and place on the cookies. Leave to cool … and enjoy.

title: Fortune cookies
text:
Egg white from 3 eggs
60g powder sugar
45g margarine
60g flour
a pinch of salt

title: Fortune cookies
text:
Procedure

Preheat the oven on 180 degree
Melt the margarine
Beat the egg white with the salt until it is fluffy
Mix the melted margarine with the powder sugar, the fluffy egg white and the flour
Using a spoon, spread a tablespoon of the dough thinly into a circle on a baking tray lined with baking paper (or a suitable alternative).
Bake it for 5-7 minutes
Now everything has to happen very quickly (it’s best if everyone helps): carefully remove the still soft cookies from the paper with a knife and place a prepared note message on top.
Fold the cookies into semicircles and quickly fold them again with the straight side over the edge of a bowl or glass to create the typical fortune cookie shape.

Enjoy your fortune!

title: Very Crispy Potatoes
text:
800g waxy potatoes
4 big spoons olive oil
2 small spoons mild paprika powder
1 small spoons salt

title: Very Crispy Potatoes
text:
800g waxy potatoes
4 big spoons olive oil
2 small spoons mild paprika powder
1 small spoons salt

title: Very Crispy Potatoes
text:
Procedure

First, peel the 800 g of potatoes and cut them into your desired shape: potato wedges, fries, cubes, wedges, or potato slices. I personally prefer the peeled and quartered wedge shape.
Place the cut potato slices directly into a bowl and mix them well with 4 tablespoons of olive oil, 2 teaspoons of mild paprika powder, and 1 teaspoon of salt. TIP: For variation, you can also mix in 1-2 teaspoons of fresh, chopped rosemary with the potatoes.
Then spread the potatoes on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Make sure they are all spread out separately and not stacked on top of each other.
They should then bake for about 30 minutes on the middle rack of the oven or until they are lightly browned and cooked through—just do the fork test or taste test. IMPORTANT NOTE: The baking time will vary depending on the cut, so keep an eye on them. I wish you much joy with my oven potato recipe and enjoy your meal.

title: Cinnamon Rolls
text:
500g all-purpose flour
7g (1 packet) instant yeast
250ml warm milk
75g granulated sugar
75g unsalted butter, melted
1 teaspoon salt
1 large egg





75g unsalted butter, softened
100g brown sugar
2 tablespoons ground cinnamon





100g powdered sugar
2-3 tablespoons milk
1 teaspoon vanilla extract (optional)

title: Cinnamon Rolls
text:
500g all-purpose flour
7g (1 packet) instant yeast
250ml warm milk
75g granulated sugar
75g unsalted butter, melted
1 teaspoon salt
1 large egg





75g unsalted butter, softened
100g brown sugar
2 tablespoons ground cinnamon





100g powdered sugar
2-3 tablespoons milk
1 teaspoon vanilla extract (optional)

title: Cinnamon Rolls
text:
Preparation

Prepare the Dough:

In a large mixing bowl, combine the warm milk and instant yeast.
Let it sit for 5-10 minutes until foamy.
Add the melted butter, sugar, salt, and egg to the yeast mixture.
Stir until well combined.
Gradually add the flour to the mixture, stirring until a dough forms.
Turn the dough out onto a floured surface and knead for about 5-7 minutes, until the dough is smooth and elastic.
Place the dough in a greased bowl, cover with a clean kitchen towel, and let it rise in a warm place for about 1 hour, or until doubled in size.
Prepare the Filling: In a small bowl, mix together the softened butter, brown sugar, and ground cinnamon until well combined.



Assemble the Rolls:

Once the dough has risen, punch it down and roll it out on a floured surface into a large rectangle, about 1/4 inch thick.
Spread the cinnamon-sugar filling evenly over the dough.
Starting from one long edge, tightly roll up the dough into a log.
Use a sharp knife to cut the log into 12 equal-sized rolls.



Bake the Rolls:

Place the rolls in a greased baking dish, leaving a little space between each roll.
Cover the dish with a clean kitchen towel and let the rolls rise for another 30-45 minutes.
Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F).
Once risen, bake the rolls in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until golden brown and cooked through.



Make the Glaze:

In a small bowl, whisk together the powdered sugar, milk, and vanilla extract until smooth.
Adjust the consistency by adding more milk if needed.
Serve: Once the rolls are baked, let them cool for a few minutes before drizzling the glaze over the top. Serve warm and enjoy your homemade Zimtschnecken!

title: Tiramisù
text: Contains raw eggs

title: Tiramisù
text:
Ingredients

4 fresh eggs
100g sugar
500g mascarpone
Savoiardi (Ladyfingers)
Espresso coffee
Cocoa powder

title: Tiramisù
text:
Procedure

Put 4 egg yolks and 50g of sugar together, mix them well so they become a bit foamy.
Add 500g mascarpone and mix to make it homogeneous.
Mix 4 egg whites so they become like snow, towards the end add the other 50g of sugar.
Mix the two mixtures together.
Put a thin layer of the cream on the bottom of the tray.
Dip the savoiardi in coffee (don’t make them too soaked as they will soften slowly and if you put too much coffee they become too liquid).
As you dip the savoiardi, place them in the tray.
Cover everything with the rest of the cream.
Sprinkle cocoa powder on top before serving.




Yummy

title: Cinnamon Roll
text:
1 (12.4 ounce) can refrigerated cinnamon rolls (such as Pillsbury™)
1/4 cup white sugar
1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon
4 ounces cream cheese, softened
3/4 cup confectioner’s sugar
1 tablespoon freshly grated orange peel
1 tablespoon orange juice
icing from the cinnamon roll package

title: Cinnamon Roll
text:
1 (12.4 ounce) can refrigerated cinnamon rolls (such as Pillsbury™)
1/4 cup white sugar
1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon
4 ounces cream cheese, softened
3/4 cup confectioner’s sugar
1 tablespoon freshly grated orange peel
1 tablespoon orange juice
icing from the cinnamon roll package

title: Cinnamon Roll
text:
Procedure

Preheat an air fryer to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C) according to manufacturer’s instructions. Add sugar and cinnamon to a large resealable plastic bag, and shake to combine.
Remove the 8 cinnamon rolls from the can, and set icing aside. Cut each roll into 4 equal pieces for a total of 32 bites.
Line the fryer basket with parchment paper. Place the bites in a single layer in the bottom of the basket, cook for 3 minutes, turn over using tongs, and cook until golden brown, another 2 to 3 minutes. Depending on the brand and size of your air fryer, you may have to cook in batches, and your timing may vary, so watch closely.
Meanwhile, prepare the dip. Add cream cheese, confectioner’s sugar, orange zest, orange juice, and the packaged icing to a small bowl. Beat with an electric mixer on medium speed until you reach a dipping consistency, about 1 minute.
Drop the warm pieces into the sugar-cinnamon mixture, and shake. Transfer to a plate or basket, and serve with the dip.

title: Poke Bowl with Tofu and Peanut Sauce
text: two servings

title: Poke Bowl with Tofu and Peanut Sauce
text:
Ingredients

For the Poke Bowl:

200 grams firm tofu
150 grams sushi rice
1 small cucumber
50 grams wakame (seaweed salad)
100 grams shelled edamame
1 small broccoli head
1 medium carrot
1 red bell pepper
1 mango
1 avocado
1 tablespoon sesame seeds
1 table spoon soy sauce
1 tablespoon rice vinegar
1 teaspoon sesame oil
1 tablespoon vegetable oil (for frying tofu)



For the Peanut Sauce:

3 tablespoons peanut butter
2 tablespoons soy sauce
1 tablespoon rice vinegar
1 tablespoon maple syrup or honey
1 teaspoon chili flakes
1 garlic clove, finely chopped
2-3 tablespoons water (to thin the sauce)

title: Poke Bowl with Tofu and Peanut Sauce
text:
Procedure

Prepare the Rice:

Rinse the sushi rice under cold water until the water runs clear.
Cook the rice according to package instructions. Once cooked, let it cool slightly.
In a small bowl, mix 1 tablespoon soy sauce, 1 tablespoon rice vinegar, and 1 teaspoon sesame oil. Pour this mixture over the cooked rice and gently mix.



Prepare the Tofu:

Drain and press the tofu to remove excess water. Cut it into bite-sized cubes.
Heat 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil in a pan over medium heat.
Fry the tofu cubes until they are golden brown on all sides. Remove from heat and set aside.



Prepare the Vegetables and Fruits:

Slice the cucumber into thin rounds.
Steam the broccoli until tender-crisp.
Julienne the carrot and red bell pepper.
Peel and cube the mango.
Cut the avocado into slices.



Prepare the Peanut Sauce:

In a bowl, mix the peanut butter, 2 tablespoons soy sauce, 1 tablespoon rice vinegar, 1 tablespoon maple syrup (or honey), 1 teaspoon chili flakes, and finely chopped garlic.
Gradually add water until the sauce reaches your desired consistency.



Assemble the Poke Bowl:

Divide the sushi rice between bowls.
Arrange the tofu, cucumber, wakame, edamame, broccoli, carrot, bell pepper, mango, and avocado on top of the rice.
Drizzle the peanut sauce over the ingredients.
Sprinkle with sesame seeds.



Serve:

Serve the poke bowl immediately. Mix everything together before eating to ensure each bite is coated with the delicious peanut sauce.
Enjoy your nutritious and flavorful poke bowl!

text:
180 g Soft Dates, pitted
200 ml Cream
3 Eggs
1/2 Vanilla Bean(s)
4 tbsp Heaped Cocoa Powder
100 g Flour
1.5 tsp Baking Soda
80 g Butter
Some Butter for greasing the pan

title: Chocolate Cake for Kids
text:
180 g Soft Dates, pitted
200 ml Cream
3 Eggs
1/2 Vanilla Bean(s)
4 tbsp Heaped Cocoa Powder
100 g Flour
1.5 tsp Baking Soda
80 g Butter
Some Butter for greasing the pan

title: Chocolate Cake for Kids
text:
Preparation

Preheat the oven to 170 °C (convection).
Puree dates with cream, vanilla bean seeds, and cocoa powder until smooth.
Then add egg yolks and butter, and blend until the mixture is homogeneous and smooth.
Beat the egg whites until stiff peaks form.
Mix the flour and baking soda into the cocoa mixture.
Gently fold in the beaten egg whites.
Pour the cake batter into any buttered baking pan.
Bake in the preheated oven on the middle rack for approximately 40 minutes.

title: Chocolate Cake for Kids
text:
Notes
The recipe yields 16 pieces and is also suitable for muffin molds. You can enhance the cake with orange zest, ground nuts, nut butter, chili, cinnamon, ginger, cardamom, or cherries. I use soft dates, which are softer than regular dates. If you only have firm dates, soak them in warm water for about 4 hours. I would use a cake pan with a diameter of 18 cm. Source: https://www.chefkoch.de/rezepte/3186881474309297/Feiner-Schokokuchen-ohne-Zuckerzusatz.html

title: Vegan Carrot Cake
text:
250g Carrots
125g Vegan Butter at room temperature
100g sugar/maple syrup
1 pinch salt
1 pinch vanilla extract
2 flax eggs
125g all-purpose flour
1/2 tsp cinnamon
1 1/2 tsp baking powder
100g almonds
1 tsp apple cider vinegar
1/2 tsp baking soda

title: Vegan Carrot Cake
text:
250g Carrots
125g Vegan Butter at room temperature
100g sugar/maple syrup
1 pinch salt
1 pinch vanilla extract
2 flax eggs
125g all-purpose flour
1/2 tsp cinnamon
1 1/2 tsp baking powder
100g almonds
1 tsp apple cider vinegar
1/2 tsp baking soda

title: Vegan Carrot Cake
text:
Procedure

Preheat oven to 180°C top and bottom heat. Grease a round baking pan.
For the batter, peel the carrots and finely grate them.
Beat the soft butter with sugar, salt, and vanilla until creamy in a mixing bowl. Then stir in the grated carrots and flax eggs.
Now sift in the flour, cinnamon, and baking powder. Also add the almonds, vinegar, and baking soda, and stir everything briefly until just combined.
Fill the batter into the prepared baking pan, smooth it out, and bake on medium rack for 30-40 minutes.

title: Peanut Udon
text:
400 g Udon (fresh)
2 tbsp salted peanuts
2 tbsp sesame
10 g fresh ginger
1 garlic clove
1 large tomato
1 tbsp sesame oil
1/2 tsp chili flakes
2 spring onions
1/2 bunch cilantro
2 tbsp soy sauce
1/2 lime
2 tbsp peanut butter
100 ml coconut milk

title: Peanut Udon
text:
400 g Udon (fresh)
2 tbsp salted peanuts
2 tbsp sesame
10 g fresh ginger
1 garlic clove
1 large tomato
1 tbsp sesame oil
1/2 tsp chili flakes
2 spring onions
1/2 bunch cilantro
2 tbsp soy sauce
1/2 lime
2 tbsp peanut butter
100 ml coconut milk

title: Peanut Udon
text:
Procedure

Roughly chop the peanuts, toast them in a pan with sesame seeds until golden brown, then transfer them to a bowl and set aside.
Peel and finely chop the ginger and garlic. Heat sesame oil in the pan and sauté the ginger, chili flakes, and garlic over medium heat.
Meanwhile, wash the tomato, dice it into small pieces, and add it to the pan.
Wash, trim, and finely slice the spring onions. Wash, shake dry, and chop the cilantro. Set both aside.
Place the noodles in a bowl, cover with hot water, and let them sit for 1-2 minutes.
Add 2 tablespoons of peanut butter to the pan and mix well. Squeeze in the lime juice. Stir in the soy sauce and coconut milk until the sauce is creamy.
Stir in 3/4 of the spring onions, drain the noodles, and add them to the peanut sauce in the pan. Mix everything well and briefly continue to fry.
Divide the noodles between 2 plates and serve garnished with the remaining spring onions, cilantro, and the sesame-peanut mixture.

title: KababDigi
text:
500g ground beef or lamb (or a mix of both)
1 large onion, grated and squeezed to remove excess water
1 tbsp turmeric
1 tsp black pepper
1 tsp salt
1 tsp cinnamon (optional)
1 tbsp saffron, bloomed in 2 tbsp hot water
2 tbsp vegetable oil (for frying)

title: KababDigi
text:
500g ground beef or lamb (or a mix of both)
1 large onion, grated and squeezed to remove excess water
1 tbsp turmeric
1 tsp black pepper
1 tsp salt
1 tsp cinnamon (optional)
1 tbsp saffron, bloomed in 2 tbsp hot water
2 tbsp vegetable oil (for frying)

title: KababDigi
text:
Procedure

Prepare the Meat:

In a large mixing bowl, combine the ground meat, grated onion (make sure to remove as much water as possible), turmeric, black pepper, salt, and cinnamon (if using). Add the bloomed saffron for a deeper flavor and color. Mix everything thoroughly until well combined.

Shape the Kebab:

Divide the mixture into small portions, then shape them into long, thin kebabs (like sausage shapes) or round patties, about 1 inch thick.

Pan-Fry the Kebab:

Heat the vegetable oil in a large, non-stick pan over medium heat. Once the oil is hot, carefully place the kebabs in the pan. Fry for about 5-7 minutes on each side until golden brown and fully cooked through.

Serve:

Serve the Kabab Digi with rice (Persian saffron rice works beautifully), fresh herbs (parsley, cilantro), grilled tomatoes, or even flatbread for a full Persian meal experience.

title: Gyoza
text:
100 g pointed cabbage
100 g carrots
100 g minced beef (or tofu)
180 g flour
108 ml boiling water
1 tbsp soy sauce
1 garlic clove
1 tsp stock powder
1 tsp white wine
1 tsp sesame oil
salt
potato starch
cooking oil

title: Gyoza
text:
100 g pointed cabbage
100 g carrots
100 g minced beef (or tofu)
180 g flour
108 ml boiling water
1 tbsp soy sauce
1 garlic clove
1 tsp stock powder
1 tsp white wine
1 tsp sesame oil
salt
potato starch
cooking oil

title: Gyoza
text:
Procedure

Mix flour, 1 tsp of salt and boiling water. When cool enough, start kneading until a smooth dough forms. Leave the dough to rest in cling film for 15 minutes.
Finely chop cabbage, garlic, carrots (and tofu) and mix with soy sauce, stock powder, sesame oil and white wine.
Divide the dough into thirds, roll the thirds into rolls, and cut into 12 pieces. Shape the pieces into “flat cakes” and roll each one in potato starch. Roll out each piece into a thin circle using a rolling pin.
Fill each dough piece with one tbsp of the cabbage mixture. Wet the edge of the circle with some water. Next, fold it into a half circle and pinch the edges together.
Heat cooking oil in a pan. Add Gyoza for about 3 minutes until they brown on the bottom. Add about half a cup of water mixed with a tbsp of flour to the bottom of the pan. Cover the Gyoza for about 8 minutes and let it simmer. Then remove the top and keep the heat on until the water is gone and a crispy bottom has formed.
Enjoy!

Pro Tipp: The recipes works much faster and makes much more fun when you do it with another person, which is why it is the perfect food for a date or an evening with friends :)

title: Bananabread
text:
2 to 3 medium (7” to 7-7/8” long) very ripe bananas, peeled (about 1 1/4 to 1 1/2 cups mashed)
1/3 cup (76g) butter, unsalted or salted, melted
1/2 teaspoon baking soda (not baking powder)
1 pinch salt
3/4 cup (150g) sugar (1/2 cup if you would like it less sweet, 1 cup if more sweet)
1 large egg, beaten
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
1 1/2 cups (205g) all-purpose flour

title: Bananabread
text:
2 to 3 medium (7” to 7-7/8” long) very ripe bananas, peeled (about 1 1/4 to 1 1/2 cups mashed)
1/3 cup (76g) butter, unsalted or salted, melted
1/2 teaspoon baking soda (not baking powder)
1 pinch salt
3/4 cup (150g) sugar (1/2 cup if you would like it less sweet, 1 cup if more sweet)
1 large egg, beaten
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
1 1/2 cups (205g) all-purpose flour

title: Bananabread
text:
Procedure

Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C): Butter an 8x4-inch loaf pan.
Mash the bananas and add the butter: In a mixing bowl, mash the ripe bananas with a fork until completely smooth. Stir the melted butter into the mashed bananas.
Mix in the remaining ingredients: Mix in the baking soda and salt. Stir in the sugar, beaten egg, and vanilla extract. Mix in the flour.
Bake the bread: Pour the batter into your prepared loaf pan.Bake for 55 to 65 minutes at 350°F (175°C), or until a toothpick or wooden skewer inserted into the center comes out clean. A few dry crumbs are okay; streaks of wet batter are not. If the outside of the loaf is browned but the center is still wet, loosely tent the loaf with foil and continue baking until the loaf is fully baked.
Cool and serve: Remove from oven and let cool in the pan for a few minutes. Then remove the banana bread from the pan and let cool completely before serving. Slice and serve. (A bread knife helps to make slices that aren’t crumbly.)

Wrapped well, the banana bread will keep at room temperature for 4 days. For longer storage, refrigerate the loaf up to 5 days, or freeze it.

title: TikTok Ramen
text:
125 grams ramen noodles
2 garlic cloves
30 grams plant-based butter
1 teaspoon chili flakes
2 teaspoons brown sugar
3 tablespoons soy sauce
1 leek
2 eggs (optional)

title: TikTok Ramen
text:
125 grams ramen noodles
2 garlic cloves
30 grams plant-based butter
1 teaspoon chili flakes
2 teaspoons brown sugar
3 tablespoons soy sauce
1 leek
2 eggs (optional)

title: TikTok Ramen
text:
Procedure

Cook the ramen in boiling salted water for about 4 minutes.
Meanwhile, peel and finely chop the garlic cloves.
Heat the plant-based butter in a pan and sauté the garlic. Stir in the chili flakes.
Stir in the brown sugar and dissolve. Add soy sauce and mix in the ramen noodles.
Remove the pan from heat and stir until the noodles are evenly coated.
Slice the leek and set it aside for garnish.
For the non-vegan version, beat two eggs and cook them in a pan until scrambled. Mix the scrambled eggs with the noodles and serve everything together.

Enjoy your meal!

title: Peanutbutter Ramen
text:
3 banana shallots, peeled and chopped to get 100g
2 lemongrass stalks, bottom two-thirds sliced, the rest discarded
10 garlic cloves (30g), peeled and roughly chopped
8cm x 8cm piece fresh ginger (60g), peeled and roughly chopped
2½ tbsp gochujang paste
1 tsp salt
1¾ tsp salt, plus ½ tsp extra for the tempeh
2 tsp Rapeseed oil
3 tsp light brown soft sugar
4 tbsp (65g) smooth peanut butter
1 x 400ml tin coconut milk
2 limes, zested and quartered
250g ramen noodles
200g tempeh, chopped into a mince with a knife
250g pak choi, shredded lengthways
40g fresh coriander, chopped

title: Peanutbutter Ramen
text:
3 banana shallots, peeled and chopped to get 100g
2 lemongrass stalks, bottom two-thirds sliced, the rest discarded
10 garlic cloves (30g), peeled and roughly chopped
8cm x 8cm piece fresh ginger (60g), peeled and roughly chopped
2½ tbsp gochujang paste
1 tsp salt
1¾ tsp salt, plus ½ tsp extra for the tempeh
2 tsp Rapeseed oil
3 tsp light brown soft sugar
4 tbsp (65g) smooth peanut butter
1 x 400ml tin coconut milk
2 limes, zested and quartered
250g ramen noodles
200g tempeh, chopped into a mince with a knife
250g pak choi, shredded lengthways
40g fresh coriander, chopped

title: Peanutbutter Ramen
text:
Procedure

1. Make curry paste:
Put all the curry paste ingredients and two tablespoons each of rapeseed oil and water in a small blender and blitz to a smooth paste.


2. Make the ramen broth:
Next, make the ramen broth. Put three tablespoons of rapeseed oil in a large saucepan on a medium heat and, once hot, add the spice paste and fry, stirring regularly, for 10 minutes. Stir in two teaspoons of the sugar and cook for a further two minutes. Transfer a tablespoon and a half of the mix to a bowl and put to one side. Stir the peanut butter into the pan, then add the coconut milk, lime zest and a litre of water. Bring up to a simmer, then cook on a low heat for 10 minutes.


3. Make the noodles & tempeh:
Meanwhile, make the noodles and tempeh. Cook the noodles according to the packet instructions, then drain in a colander, rinse under cold water and drain again. Add a little oil to the colander, toss to coat the noodles so they don’t stick, then set aside. To cook the tempeh, put two tablespoons of rapeseed oil in a nonstick frying pan on a medium heat and, when hot, add the tempeh mince and fry, stirring often, for five minutes, until crisp and browning. Add the reserved curry paste mix, the remaining teaspoon of sugar and the extra half-teaspoon of salt, fry, stirring, for another three or four minutes, then take off the heat.


4. Serve the ramen:
To serve, divide the ramen broth between four bowls, then divide the noodles between the bowls. Top with the shredded pak choy, crumbled tempeh and coriander, squeeze the juice of a quarter of a lime over each portion and serve with another lime wedge on the side of each bowl.

title: Iranian Stew Fesenjan
text:
Walnuts: To create the luscious sauce, I finely grind the walnuts.
Onion: Imbues the dish with a fresh aromatic flavor.
Chicken Thighs: When it comes to slow-cooking thighs are a top choice. Alternatively, you can use chicken drumsticks or quarters. Remove the skin but leave the bone in for further flavor.
Extra Virgin Olive Oil: The walnuts release a lot of oil so you only need a little extra virgin olive oil to fry the onions.
Turmeric, Cinnamon and Saffron: These spices flavor the stew with subtle earthy (turmeric), woody (cinnamon) and floral (saffron) tones. The overall feeling from this stew is warm. If you’re curious about saffron, one of the world’s most interesting spices, learn all about it in our What Is Saffron? Essential Guide.
Water: The cooking liquid and basis of the rich pomegranate molasses and walnut sauce.
Pomegranate Molasses: This gives the stew the sour flavor and helps to balance the richness of the walnuts in the sauce. It also gives the fesenjan its beautiful dark brown color. You can purchase it or make it yourself by using this homemade pomegranate molasses recipe.
Sugar balances and complements the tartness of the pomegranate molasses.
Salt and freshly ground black pepper elevates the other flavors and adds a subtle heat.
Pomegranate Seeds: Sprinkle these little jewel-toned bursts of flavor over the top of the stew as a garnish just before serving.

Toast the Walnuts
Cook Onions
Cook Chicken Thighs

title: Banoffee Pie
text:
1 can (400ml) sweetened condensed milk
250g HobNobs biscuits (or other crunchy cookies)
75g butter
4 medium bananas
280ml whipping cream
Cocoa powder (optional, for decoration)

title: Banoffee Pie
text:
1 can (400ml) sweetened condensed milk
250g HobNobs biscuits (or other crunchy cookies)
75g butter
4 medium bananas
280ml whipping cream
Cocoa powder (optional, for decoration)

title: Banoffee Pie
text:
Procedure

1. Prepare the Toffee:
Place the unopened can of condensed milk in a pot and cover completely with water. Boil for 2 hours, ensuring the can remains fully submerged at all times. IMPORTANT: Never open the can before or during cooking. Remove from heat and let cool completely.


2. Prepare the Base:
Crush the biscuits into fine crumbs (tip: use a freezer bag and rolling pin). Melt the butter and mix thoroughly with the biscuit crumbs. Press the mixture firmly onto a large plate or shallow dish to form a base (approximately 0.5-1cm thick). Refrigerate for 1 hour until firm.


3. Assembly:
Once the base is firm, spread the layers in this order: Layer 1: Spread the toffee (the cooked condensed milk) evenly over the base Layer 2: Peel and slice the bananas, arrange in a single layer Layer 3: Top with whipped cream (lightly sweetened) Dust with cocoa powder for decoration.


Tips:

Cook multiple cans of condensed milk at once to save time for future pies. Cooked cans have similar shelf life to unopened condensed milk.
The toffee doesn’t need to be warmed before use.
Sometimes sugar in the toffee crystallizes - this adds extra crunch.
Butter amount can be adjusted: minimum 50g to hold the base together, can use up to 100g based on preference.
For parties or individual servings: Skip the base preparation and layer toffee, bananas, and cream directly on whole biscuits (no butter needed).

Let the pie set for a few hours before serving - the flavors develop better with time.

title: Tomatosoup
text:
Butter – use unsalted butter to saute onions
Yellow onion – it seems like a ton of onion but it disappears into the soup adding a balanced sweetness
Garlic – you’ll need 1 Tbsp minced from about 3 cloves
Crushed tomatoes – with their juice, preferably
San Marzano tomatoes Chicken stock – for the best flavor use homemade chicken broth
1/4 cup fresh basil, plus more to serve. Basil leaves are easily bruised so chop by stacking a bunch of leaves then roll them into a log and cut into thin strips.
Sugar – It’s just 1 Tbsp, but necessary to combat the tomato acidity.
Black pepper – start with 1/2 tsp and add more to taste
Whipping cream – adds a creaminess to the soup and offsets acidity.
Parmesan cheese – adds saltiness to the soup and balances acidity. Adding parmesan adds enough salt and I usually don’t add more.

title: Tomatosoup
text:
Butter – use unsalted butter to saute onions
Yellow onion – it seems like a ton of onion but it disappears into the soup adding a balanced sweetness
Garlic – you’ll need 1 Tbsp minced from about 3 cloves
Crushed tomatoes – with their juice, preferably
San Marzano tomatoes Chicken stock – for the best flavor use homemade chicken broth
1/4 cup fresh basil, plus more to serve. Basil leaves are easily bruised so chop by stacking a bunch of leaves then roll them into a log and cut into thin strips.
Sugar – It’s just 1 Tbsp, but necessary to combat the tomato acidity.
Black pepper – start with 1/2 tsp and add more to taste
Whipping cream – adds a creaminess to the soup and offsets acidity.
Parmesan cheese – adds saltiness to the soup and balances acidity. Adding parmesan adds enough salt and I usually don’t add more.

title: Tomatosoup
text:
Preparation

Saute Aromatics – heat a non-reactive pot over medium heat. Melt in 4 Tbsp butter then sautee onions until softened and golden (10-12 min). Add minced garlic and saute another minute.
Make the tomato soup base – stir in two 28 oz cans of crushed tomatoes with their juice, your chicken stock, chopped basil, sugar and black pepper. Bring to a boil then reduce heat, partially cover and simmer 10 minutes.
Blend if desired – use an immersion blender in the pot or blend in batches using a blender (be careful not to overfill the blender with hot liquid) and return soup to the pot.
Add cream and parmesan – stir in the heavy cream and shredded parmesan. Return to a simmer and season to taste if needed.
Serve – ladle into warm bowls and garnish with more parmesan and basil.

title: Black Forest Cherry Dessert
text:
200 g Dark Chocolate
125 g Softened Butter
1 Pack Vanilla Sugar
3 Eggs
200 g Brown Sugar
150 g Flour
1 tsp Baking Powder
1 Pinch of Salt
1 tbsp Cocoa Powder





1 Jar Morello Cherries including Cherry Juice (Drained weight approx. 350g)
2 tsp Cornstarch
2 tbsp Powdered Sugar
400 g Cream
250 g Low-Fat Quark
4 tbsp Powdered Sugar

title: Black Forest Cherry Dessert
text:
200 g Dark Chocolate
125 g Softened Butter
1 Pack Vanilla Sugar
3 Eggs
200 g Brown Sugar
150 g Flour
1 tsp Baking Powder
1 Pinch of Salt
1 tbsp Cocoa Powder





1 Jar Morello Cherries including Cherry Juice (Drained weight approx. 350g)
2 tsp Cornstarch
2 tbsp Powdered Sugar
400 g Cream
250 g Low-Fat Quark
4 tbsp Powdered Sugar

title: Black Forest Cherry Dessert
text:
Preparation

Brownies

Melt dark chocolate with butter in a double boiler. Let it cool briefly.
Mix vanilla sugar, brown sugar, and eggs together.
Add the chocolate-butter mixture and mix.
Mix flour with baking powder, salt, and cocoa powder, and stir into the remaining batter.
Grease a brownie pan (28.5 x 23 cm).
Preheat the oven to 180 degrees Celsius (convection: 160 degrees).
Pour the batter into the pan and bake in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes.
Allow the brownies to cool completely.



Cherry Compote

Drain the Morello cherries over a sieve, collecting 400ml of juice.
Mix about 2 tbsp of the juice with cornstarch and powdered sugar until smooth.
Heat the remaining juice in a pot. Add the starch-juice mixture and bring to a boil until it starts to thicken.
Add the drained cherries and stir well.
Let it cool slightly.



Creamy Quark Cream

Whip the cream until stiff and mix with low-fat quark and powdered sugar.
Spoon 1-2 tablespoons of the cherry mixture onto the brownie pieces in the glass.



Assembly

Take 1 tablespoon of brownies and break it into small pieces.
Place brownie pieces in dessert glasses (approx. 125ml filling capacity).
Pipe a layer of cream onto the cherry mixture in each glass.
Repeat this process for another layer in each dessert glass.
Refrigerate dessert glasses until ready to serve.

title: Avocado Toast
text: A delicious avocado toast

title: Avocado Toast
text:
Ingredients

1 ripe avocado
2 slices of bread
Salt to taste
Pepper to taste
Lemon juice

title: Avocado Toast
text:
Procedure

Toast the slices of bread to your desired level of crispiness.
Cut the avocado in half, remove the pit, and scoop the flesh into a bowl. Mash the avocado with a fork until smooth.
Spread the mashed avocado evenly onto the toasted bread slices. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Add a squeeze of lemon juice if desired for extra flavor.

title: Raspberry Sponge Cake with Meringue
text:
4 egg white
4 egg yolk
270g sugar
1 vanilla sugar
60 g flour
50 g corn starch
1/2 TL baking powder
600 g frozen raspberries
0,5l cream

title: Raspberry Sponge Cake with Meringue
text:
4 egg white
4 egg yolk
270g sugar
1 vanilla sugar
60 g flour
50 g corn starch
1/2 TL baking powder
600 g frozen raspberries
0,5l cream

title: Raspberry Sponge Cake with Meringue
text:
Procedure

Whisk the egg whites and egg yolks and vanilla sugar stiff for a very long time until foamy (2 egg whites, 4 egg yolks, 1 vanilla sugar)
Sift in the flour, cornstarch and baking powder and pour everything into a greased springform pan (60 g of flour, 50 g of cornstarch, 1 teaspoon of baking powder)
Whisk the egg whites and sugar stiff until foamy and spoon onto the batter (2 egg whites, 230 g of sugar)
Bake at 175 degrees for about half an hour on the middle to lower rack.
Then let the cake cool and cut it in the middle.
Place the frozen raspberries on the bottom half, sprinkle with sugar, and then spread the whipped cream (600 g of frozen raspberries, 40 g of sugar, 0.5 liters of whipped cream)
Place the top half of the cake on the filling and let it stand for a few hours (not in the refrigerator). Alternatively, you can thaw the raspberries beforehand if there is not enough time.

title: Hähnchenbrustfilet
text:
4 chicken fillets
3 tbsp olive oil
2 cloves garlic, finely chopped
Juice of one lemon
1 tsp lemon zest, grated
1 tsp dried oregano
1 tsp dried thyme
Salt and pepper to taste
Fresh herbs (parsley, basil) for garnish

title: Hähnchenbrustfilet
text:
4 chicken fillets
3 tbsp olive oil
2 cloves garlic, finely chopped
Juice of one lemon
1 tsp lemon zest, grated
1 tsp dried oregano
1 tsp dried thyme
Salt and pepper to taste
Fresh herbs (parsley, basil) for garnish

title: Hähnchenbrustfilet
text:
Procedure

Prepare the marinade: In a bowl, mix the olive oil, chopped garlic, lemon juice, lemon zest, oregano, and thyme. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Marinate the chicken fillets: Place the chicken fillets in a large freezer bag or a shallow dish. Pour the marinade over them and rub the fillets well with it. Seal the bag or cover the dish and let the chicken marinate in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes. For a more intense flavor, marinate overnight.
Preheat the grill: Preheat a grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.
Grill the chicken: Remove the chicken fillets from the marinade and let the excess marinade drip off. Place the fillets on the hot grill and grill for about 6-8 minutes per side, until they are cooked through and have nice grill marks. The exact grilling time depends on the thickness of the fillets.
Serve: Place the grilled chicken fillets on plates and garnish with fresh herbs. They go well with a fresh salad or grilled vegetables.

Enjoy your meal!

title: Vegan Brownies
text:
1 Cup All Purpose Flour
1 Cup Granulated Sugar
1/2 Cup Cocoa Powder
1 Teaspoon Baking Powder
1/2 Cup Water
1/2 Cup Vegetable Oil or melted Coconut Oil
1 Teaspoon Vanilla Extract
1/2 cup vegan chocolate chips (optional)
1/4 Chopped Nuts (optional)

title: Vegan Brownies
text:
1 Cup All Purpose Flour
1 Cup Granulated Sugar
1/2 Cup Cocoa Powder
1 Teaspoon Baking Powder
1/2 Cup Water
1/2 Cup Vegetable Oil or melted Coconut Oil
1 Teaspoon Vanilla Extract
1/2 cup vegan chocolate chips (optional)
1/4 Chopped Nuts (optional)

title: Vegan Brownies
text:
Procedure

Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Lightly grease an 8x8-inch baking pan or line it with parchment paper.
In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking powder, and salt until well combined.
Add the water, vegetable oil (or melted coconut oil), and vanilla extract to the dry mixture. Stir until the batter is smooth and well combined.
If using, fold in the vegan chocolate chips and chopped nuts.
Pour the batter into the prepared baking pan, spreading it out evenly. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean or with a few moist crumbs.
Allow the brownies to cool completely in the pan on a wire rack before cutting into squares.
Enjoy your vegan brownies plain or with a scoop of vegan ice cream on top!

Tips:
For an extra fudgy texture, reduce the baking time slightly. Feel free to customize your brownies with your favorite mix-ins like dried fruits or seeds.
Enjoy your homemade vegan brownies!

title: Pistachio Macarons
text:
20g sugar
10g butter
40g chopped pistachio
80g white chocolate
60g whipped cream
1 drop of vanilla





50g grounded almonds
50g powdered sugar
30g egg white (best if 3 to 5 days old)
13g sugar
optional: green food coloring





baking paper for macarons
piping bag with round tip

title: Pistachio Macarons
text:
20g sugar
10g butter
40g chopped pistachio
80g white chocolate
60g whipped cream
1 drop of vanilla





50g grounded almonds
50g powdered sugar
30g egg white (best if 3 to 5 days old)
13g sugar
optional: green food coloring





baking paper for macarons
piping bag with round tip

title: Pistachio Macarons
text:
Procedure

For the filling you need to reduce the sugar into golden caramel. Take it from the stove and add the butter. After the butter is fully dissolved, add 20g of the chopped pistachios. Now put the pistachio brittle on a baking paper and let it cool down. Mix the rest of the pistachios in the blander. Heat up the white chocolate and whipped cream. Add everything (except the brittle) together and whip it up to a ganache. Keep it in the refrigerator for 20 minutes.
Shred the brittle with the blender and mix it under the ganache. Keep the ganache in your refrigerator over night.
For the macrons shells mix the grounded almonds and the powdered sugar using the blender. Sieve the mixture until it is a light powder. Mix the egg white until it’s white and fluffy. Slowly add the rest of the sugar. Optional you can add the green food coloring now. Fold the egg white in the almond-sugar mix, until you get a gluey dough.
Fill dough into piping bag. Put baking paper on a tray. Pipe 24 round spots on the paper. Reduce air pockets in the dough by beating on the pan. Leave baking pan for at least 30 minutes in the room. The shells need to be dry. Preheat the oven up to 160°C and bake the macarons shells for at least 13 minutes (depends on the oven, my oven needs 20 minutes).
Let the macarons shells chill down. Now you can fill them with the ganache and enjoy.

title: Pasta alla Norma
text:
600 g pasta (e.g. penne)
150 g to 200 g ricotta salata, grated (alternatively pecorino or parmesan)
2 aubergines
1 bottle of tomato passata (approx. 700 g)
1 clove of garlic
1 handful of basil leaves
1 pinch of sugar
Salt & pepper
Olive oil
Sunflower oil for frying

title: Pasta alla Norma
text:
600 g pasta (e.g. penne)
150 g to 200 g ricotta salata, grated (alternatively pecorino or parmesan)
2 aubergines
1 bottle of tomato passata (approx. 700 g)
1 clove of garlic
1 handful of basil leaves
1 pinch of sugar
Salt & pepper
Olive oil
Sunflower oil for frying

title: Pasta alla Norma
text:
Procedure

Cook the ramen in boiling salted water for about 4 minutes.
Meanwhile, peel and finely chop the garlic cloves.
Heat the plant-based butter in a pan and sauté the garlic. Stir in the chili flakes.
Stir in the brown sugar and dissolve. Add soy sauce and mix in the ramen noodles.
Remove the pan from heat and stir until the noodles are evenly coated.
Slice the leek and set it aside for garnish.
For the non-vegan version, beat two eggs and cook them in a pan until scrambled. Mix the scrambled eggs with the noodles and serve everything together.
PREPARING THE AUBERGINES
Wash the aubergines, cut off the ends and cut into 1x1 cm cubes. You can also cut a few thin slices from the aubergine for decoration. Sprinkle with a little salt and leave to stand in a sieve for 1 hour.
Place a suitable bowl with a weight (e.g. water) in the sieve to weigh down the aubergines.
Note: Salting removes water and bitter substances from the aubergines. Even though the bitter substances have been bred out of most types of aubergine nowadays, it is still worth salting them, as this removes water from the aubergine and makes them crispier when deep-frying.
FOR THE TOMATO SAUCE
Heat a little olive oil in a pan over a medium heat and add the garlic clove, allowing it to colour and flavour the oil.
Add the tomato passata and a pinch of sugar, season with salt and pepper and add the basil leaves. 8. Leave to simmer for approx. 15 mins. Stir occasionally.
PREPARE THE AUBERGINES
Meanwhile, deep-fry the aubergine cubes in plenty of sunflower oil until golden brown and then drain well on kitchen paper. Then add to the tomato sauce.
FOR THE PASTA
Cook the pasta in salted water until al dente, drain and mix with the sauce.
Arrange on plates, sprinkle with the ricotta and serve immediately.

Et viola, enjoy your meal!

title: Indian Dal with Red Lentils
text:
1-2 tbsp coconut oil or olive oil for frying
2 onions diced
4 garlic cloves minced
2 tsp ginger grated (or more to taste)
1 tsp turmeric
1 tsp coriander
1 tsp cumin
1 tsp red paprika
1 tsp garam masala or other curry powder to taste
300 g red lentils
780 ml vegetable stock
250 ml coconut milk
250 ml pureed tomatoes or chopped tomatoes (optional)
Salt and pepper to taste
2 tsp coconut blossom sugar or to taste
2-3 tbsp lime or lemon juice or to taste

title: Indian Dal with Red Lentils
text:
Procedure

Heat the coconut oil in a pan or pot. Add the chopped onions and sauté for 2-3 minutes until translucent. Then add the garlic and ginger and sauté for another minute until fragrant. Finally add the spices and sauté for a few seconds to allow the flavors to develop.
Place the lentils in a fine sieve and rinse under cold running water. Then add it to the onion mixture in the pan, pour in the vegetable stock, stir and bring to the boil. Cover and simmer for 8-10 minutes, or until the lentils have absorbed most of the liquid.
Then add coconut milk and pureed tomatoes (if using) and simmer for another 5-10 minutes, or until the lentils are cooked. (If the sauce is too thick, add a little more broth or coconut milk until the desired consistency is reached). Season with salt, pepper, coconut blossom sugar and lime juice.
Garnish the dal with a swirl of vegan yogurt, freshly chopped parsley or coriander and sesame seeds or any other topping of your choice. Serve over rice or with vegan naan or aloo paratha. But it also tastes good as a filling for savory pancakes, crepes or tortilla recipes.

Enjoy your meal!

title: Muesli recipe
text:
200 g oats
20 g flour
1 tbsp honey
2 tbsp sunflower oil
50 ml water

title: Muesli recipe
text:
200 g oats
20 g flour
1 tbsp honey
2 tbsp sunflower oil
50 ml water

title: Muesli recipe
text:
Procedure

Place all the ingredients in a bowl and mix, preferably by hand, until the dough forms a large lump. The lump should not stick, but should also not fall apart easily. If, for example, the consistency is not right when adding up the ingredients, simply add water, flour or oat flakes carefully.
Finally, crumble the mixture onto a baking tray lined with baking paper. The amount given is pretty much enough for a normal-sized tray. There’s no need to worry about the lumps baking together and you can use up all the space.
Preheat the oven to 160 °C and bake the muesli for about 30 minutes.
The baking time can vary depending on how the oven behaves or how tightly you have covered the tray. Just make sure that you take the muesli out when it starts to get a little dark. Don’t be disappointed if it isn’t crispy when you take it out: it will only be really crispy once it has cooled.
Finally, you can add chocolate, nuts, seeds or dried fruit such as raisins or cranberries to taste.

title: Lentil Bolognese

1 onion

400 g strained tomatoes - or chopped tomatoes (= 1 tin)

salt
pepper

title: Lentil Bolognese
text:
1 clove of garlic
1 onion
1 carrot
1 stalk of celery
1 tbsp olive oil
2 tablespoons tomato paste
150 g red lentils
400 g strained tomatoes - or chopped tomatoes (= 1 tin)
250 ml vegetable stock
1 tbsp Italian herbs
salt
pepper

title: Lentil Bolognese
text:
Procedure

Wash the lentils thoroughly, then set aside.
Finely chop the garlic and onion, dice the carrot and celery.
Heat the oil in a pan and sauté the onions.
Add the carrots and celery and fry for 5 minutes over a medium heat.
Stir in the tomato purée, garlic and herbs.
Add the tomato purée, vegetable stock and lentils, bring to the boil, cover and simmer over a medium heat for 15 minutes. Add water if necessary.

Source: https://www.gaumenfreundin.de/rote-linsenbolognese-einfach-und-vegan/
